section.title: Conditionals review
section.sectiontitle: To talk about something that is always true, use If + Present Simple + Present Simple.
section.text1a: If you go into business with relatives, it tends to put a strain on your relationship.
section.text2a: If the summer is long and hot, the flowers die early.
section.sectiontitle2: To talk about a possible real situation in the future, use If + Present Simple + will (might/may/could/should).
section.text3a: If we find a bank, we could change some money.
section.text4a: We should stop for petrol if we see a petrol station.

section.title: Conditionals review
section.sectiontitle: To talk about a hypothetical or unlikely situation in the future, use If + Past Simple + would (might/may/could/should).
section.text1a: If they asked me to go back, I wouldn't hesitate.
section.text2a: I could help you if I had more time.
section.sectiontitle2: To talk about a hypothetical past situation, use If + Past Perfect + would have (could have/should have/might have).
section.text3a: If she had taken her phone, we would have been able to call her.
section.text4a: We couldn't have found the house if we hadn't brought the map.

section.title: Conditionals review
section.sectiontitle: To talk about past regrets, use If only/I wish + Past Perfect.
section.text1a: If only I hadn't told him about Johnny.
section.text2a: I wish we had moved here sooner.
section.sectiontitle2: Mixed conditionals. These may express a hypothetical present result of a past action. If + Past Perfect + would/could/may/might/should.
section.text3a: If we hadn't answered the advertisement, we wouldn't be here now.
section.text4a: If you hadn't lost the keys, we wouldn't have this problem.

section.title: Conditionals review
section.sectiontitle: Other words/phrases can be used with, or instead of if  in conditional sentences: provided that, as long as, if only, should you, happen to, supposing, if it hadn't been for, etc.
section.text1a: Provided that you leave a deposit, you can come and go as you please.
section.text2a: Should you happen to need anything else, I'll be in the office until noon.
